Description: Neck and shoulder fragment, and small loose fragments, of a glass vase. Clear blue(?) with opaque white and opaque orange (?) trails. Lower part of cylindrical neck meeting broad, convex shoulder in gentle, obtuse-angled curve. On neck a feather pattern of white and orange (?); on shoulder, a horizontal triple spiral of white above a feather pattern of white and orange(?).Core-formed and tooled, trails marvered and combed.
Curator's comments: BM Glass Nolte 1968, 118, s.n. 36a (described, but without reg. no., and said, not quite accurately, to be from Klaudia, near Larnaka).
Bibliographic references: Glass / Catalogue of Greek and Roman Glass in the British Museum (19)
Malmgren 2003 / Klavdhia-Tremithos. A Middle and Late Cypriote Bronze Age site. (no. 145, p.55)
Peltenburg 1986 / Ramesside Egypt and Cyprus (p. 153, no. 9)
Kiely 2011d / Klavdia-Tremithos: A Bronze Age community in south-east Cyprus (U.33)
Condition: Black surface-coat inside and out, covering a whitish layer of decomposition, mostly obscuring the colour.
